title: Project-Based Design Process for Calculus Learning Objects

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic calculus and linear algebra concepts
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environments for social sector applications targeting in-service practitioners.

learning_goals: Learners can apply core calculus concepts (differentiation, integration, limits) to real-world social problems using learning objects (TUM-based)
Enhances the ability to systematically analyze and solve complex calculus problems through an interactive platform
Enables the creation of outcomes applying calculus theory to practical cases via project-based assessment
Promotes motivation for learning and self-directed learning competencies
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
